page.title: 10CLUBS & PUBS-OUTWOOD AREA
page.content: DURING THE VICTORIAN ERA MINERS' WELFARE CLUBS WERE ESTABLISHED AND THESE EVOLVED INTO THE WORKING MEN'S CLUBS OF TODAY TO BE FOUND THROUGHOUT OUR AREA. FOUNDED AS SOCIAL CLUBS FOR MEN WHERE BEER WAS CHEAP AND DOMINOES, DARTS AND BILLIARDS COULD BE PLAYED, THEY NOW OFFER DANCING, BINGO AND ENTERTAINMENT IN ADDITION AND HAVE EXTENDED MEMBERSHIP TO LADIES.MANY HAVE THEIR OWN DARTS AND FOOTBALL TEAMS WHICH PLAY IN LOCAL LEAGUE COMPETITIONS.PUBLIC HOUSES (PUBS) HAVE SIMILARY EVOLVED FROM BEER HOUSES TO CATERING ESTABLISHMENTS WHERE MEALS OR SNACKS MAY BE BOUGHT AS WELL AS DRINK. MANY HAVE FAMILY ROOMS WHERE CHILDREN CAN GO WITH THEIR PARENTS BUT NOT INTO THE BAR.PUBS AND CLUBS ORGANISE COACH OUTINGS IN THE SUMMER TO COASTAL RESORTS OR PLACES OF INTEREST.
